author: William Mauldin
title: U.S. Companies Will Get Few Exclusions to Tariffs, Officials Signal
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”U.S. businesses seeking to avoid tariffs on imported supplies that incorporate steel and aluminum will face high hurdles under rules being developed by the Commerce Department, which is signaling it will grant exclusions only sparingly and based on national-security concerns.
Commerce officials are preparing to release, either at the end of this week or early next week, a detailed blueprint for industry groups seeking exclusions, according to people familiar with the plans.
...
